choices.question: Which of the following permutation in \(S_7\) commutes with \(\theta = \begin {pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 & 6 & 7\\ 1 & 5 & 4 & 3 & 7 & 6 & 2 \end {pmatrix}\)?

Let \(\theta , \sigma \in S_5\) be given by \(\sigma = \begin {pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\ 2 & 5 & 1 & 3 & 4 \end {pmatrix}\) and \(\theta = \begin {pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\ 4 & 5 & 3 & 2 & 1 \end {pmatrix}\). Then \(\sigma \circ \theta \) maps \(2\) to ____________ and the image of \(2\) under \(\sigma \theta \) is ____________
Let \(\theta , \sigma \in S_n\). Then the product \(\theta \sigma = \)____________.
In the standard notation, \(\varphi \in S_3\) is given by
In the standard notation, \(\psi \in S_3\) is given by
In the standard notation, the inverse of \(\varphi \in S_3\) is ____________.
In the standard notation, the inverse of \(\psi \in S_3\) is ____________.
In the standard notation, the inverse of \(\psi ^2 \in S_3\) is ____________.
In the standard notation, the inverse of \(\varphi \psi \in S_3\) is ____________.
The number of self-inverse elements (i.e., inverse of itself) in \(S_3\) is ____________.
The number of elements in \(S_3\) which are not self-inverses (i.e., which are not inverses of itself) is ____________.
Let \(T = \{x \in S_3 \mid x \neq e,\ x^3 = e\}\). Then the cardinality of the set \(T\) is ____________.
In the standard notation, in \(S_3\), \(\psi ^2 \varphi \) is ____________.
In the standard notation, in \(S_3\), \((\varphi \psi )(\psi \varphi ) = \) ____________.
Let \(G\) be a group. The group \(A(G)\) is non-abelian if and only if

For any symbol \(a\) and some fixed \(n \in \mathbb N\), the set \(\{a^0, a, a^2, \ldots, a^{n}\}\) such that \(a^{n+1} = a^0 = e\) is ____________ under the following operation: \[a^i a^j = \left \{\begin {array}{ll} a^{i+j} &\ \text { if } i + j \le n\\ a^{i+j-n-1} &\ \text { if } i + j > n \end {array}\right .\]
Let \(a, b, c\) be elements of a group \(G\). Then the inverse of their product \(abc\) is ____________.
Let \(G\) be a group and \(H\) and \(K\) be subgroups of \(G\). Then ____________is necessarily a subgroup of \(G\).
Which of the following sets is not a subgroup of \(A(\mathbb Z)\)?
answers: \(\{\sigma \in A(\mathbb Z) \mid \sigma (n) \neq n \text { for all but finitely many } n \in \mathbb Z\}\)
\(\{\sigma \in A(\mathbb Z) \mid \sigma (n) = n \text { for all but finitely many } n \in \mathbb Z\}\)
\(\{\sigma \in A(\mathbb Z) \mid \sigma (n) = n \text { for all } n \in \mathbb Z\}\)

choices.question: Let \(S\) be a nonempty set and \(x_0, x_1 \in S\). Which of the following is a subgroup of \(A(S)\)?
In \(S_3\), the cyclic subgroup generated by \(\varphi \) is ____________.
In \(S_3\), the cyclic subgroup generated by \(\psi \) is ____________.
In \(S_3\), the cyclic subgroup generated by \(\psi ^2\) is ____________.
In \(S_3\), the cyclic subgroup generated by ____________is same
Let \(W = \{\varphi , \psi \}\) be a subset of \(S_3\). In usual notations, \((W) = \) ____________.
Let \(W = \{\varphi \psi \}\) be a subset of \(S_3\). In usual notations, \((W) = \) ____________.
